summary_of_threads_started_this_week: Valuedmammal's project on analyzing CSV data, hosted on [GitHub](https://github.com/ValuedMammal/mempool-util/tree/main/assets), has reached an advanced stage, focusing on conducting an analysis of variance to understand data variability. This essential step aims to identify significant differences between groups within the data, crucial for deriving reliable and meaningful conclusions. The project underscores the importance of statistical methods in ensuring the validity of findings from the CSV dataset.

new_threads_this_week.title: Casual research on running `mempoolfullrbf`
new_threads_this_week.summary:
- The project focuses on analyzing CSV data accessible via a GitHub repository.
- A pending task in the project is conducting an analysis of variance.
- This analysis is crucial for deriving valid conclusions from the data.

active_posts_this_week.title: A "Free" Relay Attack Taking Advantage of The Lack of Full-RBF In Core
active_posts_this_week.summary:
- Peter Todd critiques Bitcoin protocol development and highlights miners' roles and attack vectors.
- He discusses the need for protocol design to account for game theory and operational interdependencies.
- Todd calls for a more informed approach to developing Bitcoin and its second-layer solutions.

active_posts_this_week.title: Proposing a P2QRH BIP towards a quantum resistant soft fork
active_posts_this_week.summary:
- The specification update now includes FALCON, per Antoine's suggestions.
- It adds a section on integrating two post-quantum cryptosystems, increasing maintenance needs.
- Reviewers can see these changes in a detailed GitHub pull request linked.

active_posts_this_week.title: Mining pools, stratumv2 and oblivious shares
active_posts_this_week.summary:
- Block withholding in Bitcoin pooling jeopardizes success rates through miners not producing valid blocks.
- Statistical analysis plays a critical role in detecting these block withholding attacks by identifying anomalies.
- Stratum V2 integration emphasizes miner autonomy in work selection to uphold Bitcoin's decentralization principle.

active_posts_this_week.title: Is it time to increase the blocksize cap?
active_posts_this_week.summary:
- Optimal block size should dynamically adjust according to on-chain demand fluctuations.
- Small blocks encourage high fee competition and Layer 2 solution usage, distributing network costs.
- Large blocks may lower fees and necessitate tail emission to ensure network security, affecting all holders.

active_posts_this_week.title: Zawy’s Alternating Timestamp Attack
active_posts_this_week.summary:
- Adjusting difficulty levels in mining by implementing a past-time limit on blocks was proposed.
- Concerns were discussed about the effectiveness of removing the Median Time Past requirement with this method.
- The conversation explored targeted consensus rule changes to prevent timestamp manipulation and enhance mining security.

active_posts_this_week.title: Stable Channels - peer-to-peer dollar balances on Lightning
active_posts_this_week.summary:
- The discussion highlights the irony of unstable channels in the Lightning Network.
- These unreliable channels affect transaction speeds and user experience.
- Improving channel stability is essential for the network's performance and satisfaction.
